title: ðŸš§ 5 Apartment Renovation Mistakes Beginners Make
description: Five common renovation mistakes â€” planning, budgeting, materials, utilities, and contractor control â€” and how to avoid them.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Renovation Pitfalls: 5 Costly Mistakes to Avoid

> Before you start renovating your apartment, check these five traps that ruin budgets and timelines.  
> A quick, essential guide to help you spot trouble early.

---

## 1. Skipping the Detailed Project Plan

What goes wrong: rework, blown deadlines, and wasted money on undone finishes.  
Quick checklist:  
**layout â†’ electrical/low-voltage â†’ plumbing â†’ leveling â†’ rough floors and walls â†’ finishing â†’ doors/hardware â†’ furniture â†’ dÃ©cor.**

See also our [renovation tips article](/en/posts/renovation-tips-5).

---

## 2. Underestimating Budget and Hidden Costs

Always add **+10â€“20%** for unexpected work, debris removal, delivery, consumables, tools, and permits.  
Even "small stuff" like anchors, primer, and sealant adds up fast.  
Learn more in [how to save money on renovation](/en/posts/how-to-save-money-on-renovation).

---

## 3. Overlooking Electrical and Plumbing Essentials

Separate power circuits, match cable gauges to load, and install RCDs/MCBs where required.  
Waterproof wet zones, leave revision hatches, and keep connections accessible â€” otherwise you'll be redoing tile in a month.

---

## 4. Choosing Materials Without Research

Where you can save vs. where you must not:
- **Can save on:** wallpaper, baseboards, handles.
- **Do not cut corners on:** leveling compounds, wiring, pipes, flooring in wet zones.

Always check **durability class**, moisture resistance, manufacturer warranty, and system compatibility.  
See our [renovation tips article](/en/posts/renovation-tips-5) for material selection advice.

---

## 5. Losing Control of Contractors and Timeline

No contract with milestones = instant chaos.  
You need a **timeline**, acceptance checklists, photo evidence of hidden work, and penalties for missed deadlines.  
Learn more in our [renovation tips article](/en/posts/renovation-tips-5).

---

## Key Takeaways for a Smooth Renovation

Renovation requires a system: plan â†’ budget â†’ supervision.  
Avoid these five mistakes and you'll save **time, money, and nerves**.  
Also read our [renovation tips article](/en/posts/renovation-tips-5).

---

title: Top 5 Bathroom Renovation Mistakes You Must Avoid
description: Discover the most common bathroom remodeling pitfalls, from poor lighting to insufficient storage, and learn how to prevent them in your next project.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
Renovating a bathroom is a significant investment. However, even small miscalculations can lead to major inconveniences down the line. Here are five common bathroom renovation mistakes and how to avoid them.

## 1. Underestimating Storage Needs

One of the most frequent errors is prioritizing aesthetics over functionality, leading to a severe lack of storage space for daily essentials.

![Sleek floating vanity providing ample storage](/images/posts/bathroom-mistakes/2.png)

**How to avoid it:** 
Plan your storage in advance. Consider adding a spacious floating vanity, recessed wall niches in the shower area, and mirrored cabinets. Floating vanities not only provide ample storage but also make the floor visible, which visually enlarges the room.

## 2. Inadequate or Harsh Lighting

A single overhead light is never enough for a bathroom. It creates harsh shadows and makes tasks like shaving or applying makeup difficult.

![Properly illuminated bathroom mirror](/images/posts/bathroom-mistakes/1.png)

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> A layered lighting scheme is usually the best approach for bathrooms: ambient (general), task (around the mirror), and accent (for atmosphere).

**How to avoid it:** 
Install soft LED strips around or behind the mirror to provide even, shadow-free lighting. Use moisture-protected fixtures and choose the IP rating based on the installation zone: IP44 is often used for splash zones, while direct water-exposure zones require higher protection.

## 3. Ignoring Proper Ventilation

Poor ventilation leads to a buildup of moisture, which inevitably causes mold, peeling paint, and damaged woodwork. 

**How to avoid it:** 
Invest in a high-quality, quiet exhaust fan. It's best to wire it to a separate switch or use one with a built-in humidity sensor so it runs automatically when needed.

## 4. Wrong Choice of Materials

Using materials that are not suitable for high-humidity environments will quickly ruin the look of your newly renovated bathroom. For instance, using regular drywall instead of moisture-resistant drywall in wet zones.

**How to avoid it:** 
Porcelain stoneware is often preferred for floors because of its low water absorption and high durability. For walls, ceramic tiles or high-quality water-resistant paint are excellent choices. In direct water-contact areas like showers, epoxy grout is usually more durable, though it is more expensive and harder to apply.

## 5. Overlooking the Layout and Ergonomics

Placing the toilet right opposite the door or not leaving enough clearance around fixtures can make a bathroom feel cramped and awkward.

**How to avoid it:** 
Respect standard ergonomic clearances: leave at least 70 cm of clear space in front of the toilet and sink. If space is tight, reconsider the layout or swap a large bathtub for a spacious walk-in shower.

title: Apartment Renovation 2026: How to Turn Chaos into a Clear Plan
description: A step-by-step apartment renovation guide for 2026: preparation, rough-in and finishing phases, material choices, budget planning, furniture, and lighting. Practical tips and common mistakes.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Apartment Renovation 2026: How to Turn Chaos into a Clear Plan

Renovating an apartment is not just an update to finishes â€” it's an investment in comfort and property value. A well-executed renovation can raise a home's market value by 20â€“30%, and smart engineering choices can significantly reduce utility costs.

To keep the process from turning into endless stress, it's vital to understand the workflow, the sequence of operations, and the rules of planning. Below is a practical, step-by-step renovation plan for 2026.

![Apartment renovation planning](/images/remont-kvartiry-plan-2026/planning.jpg "Apartment renovation planning")

## Stage 1: Preparation

### Assessing the space and building a budget

Start with a thorough inspection. Identify which systems (HVAC, plumbing, electrical) must be replaced and what can remain. Then build a budget that includes materials, labor, and a contingency fund (usually +15â€“20% for unforeseen expenses).

Tip: Use online renovation calculators to forecast costs and compare quotes before you commit.

### Choosing an interior style: from Minimalism to Neoclassical

Define your design vision before work starts. The trending styles in 2026 include:

- Scandinavian Minimalism â€” light, simplicity, natural materials;
- Industrial / Loft â€” exposed textures, metal, open plans;
- Neoclassical â€” balanced elegance and timeless harmony;
- Biophilic / Eco â€” natural tones, sustainable materials, and greenery.

### How to hire the right contractor

When selecting a construction team:

- review portfolios and verify references;
- sign a detailed contract with clear warranties;
- track progress at each milestone.

Tip: Avoid verbal agreements â€” document everything in the scope of work and contract.

## Stage 2: The Rough-in Phase

This phase is the foundation of the entire project. It includes:

- demolition;
- structural changes;
- MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing) rough-ins;
- surface preparation.

### Demolition and strip-out

Old flooring, doors, fixtures, and non-load-bearing walls are removed. It is a dusty but necessary start.

### Systems and leveling

After demolition, move to engineering: running new electrical cables, plumbing pipes, and HVAC ducts. Only after these are installed do you proceed to leveling the subfloor, plastering walls, and framing ceilings.

![Rough renovation work](/images/remont-kvartiry-plan-2026/rough-work.jpg "Rough renovation stage")

## Stage 3: The Finishing Phase

This is where the interior style comes to life.

### Wall finishes: Paint, Wallpaper, Tile

Choose quality, low-VOC materials. For example:

- water-based acrylic/latex paint â€” durable and safe;
- non-woven wallpaper â€” breathable and easy to install;
- large-format porcelain tile â€” seamless look and high durability.

### How to choose flooring

**Laminate**  
Pros: affordable, easy click-lock installation.  
Cons: sensitive to standing water.

**Engineered Wood**  
Pros: natural look, warm feel.  
Cons: higher cost.

**Tile / Stone**  
Pros: extremely durable, waterproof.  
Cons: cold underfoot (needs underfloor heating).

**Microcement / Resin**  
Pros: sleek, modern, seamless.  
Cons: requires professional application.

![Finishing materials and surfaces](/images/remont-kvartiry-plan-2026/finishing.jpg "Materials for finish work")

## Stage 4: Furniture, Decor, and Lighting

### Lighting as a key to comfort

Lighting is functional and atmospheric. Layer your lighting: combine ambient (general), task (work areas), and accent (decorative) light.

![Lighting and comfort](/images/remont-kvartiry-plan-2026/lighting.jpg "Lighting scenarios in the interior")

### How to arrange furniture to maximize space

Use zoning techniques and mirrors â€” they visually expand the room and keep the interior airy.

### 2026 Trends

- smart, multifunctional furniture;
- warm neutral tones (beige, taupe, terracotta);
- sustainable decor (recycled materials, natural wood, stone).

## How much does renovation cost in 2026?

Costs vary significantly by location, scope, and finish quality. The final budget usually depends on:

- size and layout complexity;
- condition of existing systems (wiring, piping);
- selection of finish materials and fixtures;
- custom joinery and built-ins;
- contractor rates and project timeline.

Tip: Get at least three detailed quotes to compare market rates before starting.

## Common renovation mistakes

- starting without a detailed plan or design;
- underestimating the budget;
- choosing cheap materials for high-traffic areas;
- ignoring lighting plans until the end.

## FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions

1. **How long does a renovation take?**  
   Typically 2 to 6 months for a full apartment renovation, depending on size and complexity.
2. **Can renovation be done in winter?**  
   Yes, interior work can be done year-round, provided the building is heated and dry.
3. **How can I avoid overspending?**  
   Stick to your plan. Changes made during construction are the #1 cause of budget overruns.
4. **Do I need an interior designer?**  
   Highly recommended for extensive remodels or complex layouts to ensure space efficiency.
5. **Can I live in the apartment during renovation?**  
   For cosmetic updates â€” yes. For full renovations (kitchen/bath/floors) â€” it is strongly advised to move out for safety and speed.
6. **Which materials last the longest?**  
   Porcelain tile, high-quality LVT (Luxury Vinyl Tile), and engineered hardwoods.

## Conclusion: How to make renovation enjoyable

Renovation is not chaos â€” it's a chance to create your dream home. The keys are detailed planning, a reliable contractor, and patience. A quality renovation is an investment in your comfort for years to come.

## Next article

- Renovating an Older Property: A Systematic Approach
- Complete guide to updating older apartments: inspections, upgrading utilities, and preserving character.

## Related Articles

- Modern Design Trends 2026: Biophilic design and smart technology.
- Renovating a Shell & Core Apartment: A guide to starting from scratch.
- 5 Tips to Stay Sane During Construction: Stress management for homeowners.

Choosing an interior style: from Minimalism to Neoclassical

How to arrange furniture to maximize space
How much does renovation cost in 2026?

title: ðŸŒ™ Bedroom Design: Comfort, Light and Inspiration
description: Modern bedroom ideas â€” from Scandinavian minimalism to warm textures, soft light, and natural harmony.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Creating Your Sanctuary: Modern Bedroom Design Principles

> The bedroom is the most personal space in any home.  
> It's where we rest, recover, and start our day.  
> The goal of good design is to build calmness, comfort, and balance.

---

## Embrace Natural Materials for Warmth and Texture

![Natural materials in a cozy bedroom](/images/bedrooms/bedroom-01.png)

Wood, linen, cotton, and ceramics bring warmth and tactile richness to your bedroom.  
These materials "breathe," improve room acoustics, and create a natural, organic atmosphere.  
The subtle imperfections in natural materials add character and make the space feel more authentic and inviting.

---

## Master the Art of Soft Lighting

![Warm and diffused bedroom lighting](/images/bedrooms/bedroom-02.png)

Lighting should be warm, layered, and completely controllable.  
Combine wall sconces, floor lamps, and dimmable overhead lighting to create different moods throughout the day.  
**Avoid harsh white light** â€” it can make even the coziest bedroom feel clinical and unwelcoming. Instead, opt for warm white bulbs (2700K-3000K) for evening relaxation.

---

## Build on a Calm Color Foundation

![Neutral bedroom color palette](/images/bedrooms/bedroom-03.png)

The 2025 trend embraces soothing neutrals: sand, cream, terracotta, and olive green.  
These colors promote relaxation and mental clarity while providing a perfect backdrop for textures and lighting to take center stage.  
Even the simplest bedroom arrangement feels sophisticated when built on this calm color foundation.

---

## Scandinavian Simplicity Meets Comfort

![Modern Scandinavian-style bedroom](/images/bedrooms/bedroom-04.png)

Modern bedroom design successfully blends minimalist aesthetics with deep comfort.  
The secret lies in creating a space that feels peaceful at night and inspiring each morning.  
Focus on clean lines, uncluttered surfaces, and intentional decor that serves both form and function.

---

## Find Inspiration in Contrast

![Loft bedroom with brick wall and industrial accents](/images/bedrooms/bedroom-05.png)

Sometimes the most inspiring bedrooms come from unexpected combinations.  
Even raw industrial materials â€” exposed brick, metal accents, or concrete floors â€” can feel surprisingly warm and inviting when balanced with soft textiles, gentle lighting, and organic shapes.  
Don't be afraid to mix styles for a truly personal space.

---

## Your Bedroom Design Checklist

- [ ] Choose natural, breathable materials
- [ ] Layer warm, dimmable lighting
- [ ] Build on a neutral color palette
- [ ] Prioritize comfort and functionality
- [ ] Add personal touches intentionally
- [ ] Maintain clean, uncluttered surfaces

---

title: Cave Living: Modern Design in the Heart of Nature
description: Real examples of homes and interiors built into rock â€” bedrooms, bathrooms, and living rooms inspired by nature. How architects create comfort carved directly into stone.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Living in Stone: The Modern Cave Home Revolution

When we hear the word *"cave,"* we usually imagine darkness and damp air.  
But in the 21st century, architects have proven that **life in stone can be beautiful, bright, and comfortable** â€” not primitive at all.

---

## Blending Architecture with Natural Form

The *cave living* trend emerged from the idea of uniting architecture with nature.  
Instead of destroying mountains, designers embrace their natural shapes, turning stone into part of the interior itself.

---

## Global Inspirations: Cave Dwellings Around the World

**Cappadocia, Turkey.**  
Ancient caves here have been transformed into elegant **boutique hotels** â€” such as *Mithra Cave Hotel* and *Museum Hotel*.  
Stone arches, vaulted ceilings, and soft lighting create an atmosphere of warmth and tranquility.

![Cave hotel in Cappadocia](/images/cave-living/cappadocia-hotel.png)

**Guadix, Spain.**  
Many families live in "cave houses" â€” homes carved directly into the rock.  
They have electricity, heating, and even Wi-Fi.

![Cave houses in Spain](/images/cave-living/spain-houses.png)

**Arkansas, USA.**  
The famous *Beckham Creek Cave Lodge* is built deep inside a massive cliff.  
Inside, a natural waterfall (*Spanish Piano Waterfall*) flows through the living space, while stone walls are combined with modern luxury â€” Wi-Fi, panoramic windows, and high-end comfort.

![Beckham Creek Cave Lodge](/images/cave-living/modern-cave-house.png)

---

## Iconic Cave Architecture Projects

- **Cave houses in Lebanon and Greece** â€” combining stone, glass, and terraces with pools.
- **Cave interiors** â€” bedrooms and bathrooms designed with respect for natural forms and textures.

These projects show that *living in stone* isn't exotic â€” it's a **notable trend in modern architecture** that merges sustainability and aesthetics.

---

## The Practical Benefits of Cave Living

1. **Stable temperature** â€” stone naturally regulates heat.
2. **Energy efficiency** â€” lower heating and cooling costs.
3. **Silence and privacy** â€” the rock absorbs sound.
4. **Eco-friendliness** â€” the home becomes part of the landscape.

---

## Interior Design for Stone Spaces

The combination of **raw natural forms** and **modern furniture** looks truly impressive.  
No unnecessary details â€” just stone, wood, metal, and soft lighting.

### Bedroom Design in Natural Stone
![Cave bedroom](/images/cave-living/bedroom.png)

### Bathroom Carved from Rock
![Cave bathroom](/images/cave-living/bathroom.png)

### Living Room with Stone Walls
![Cave living room](/images/cave-living/living-room.png)

### Architectural Entrance Solutions
![Cave entrance](/images/cave-living/entrance.png)

### Kitchen Design in Cave Setting
![Cave kitchen](/images/cave-living/kitchen.png)

### Relaxation and Spa Areas
![Cave spa lounge](/images/cave-living/spa.png)

---

## Bringing Cave Aesthetics to Urban Living

Even if you live in a regular apartment, you can still be inspired.  
Add a touch of the cave aesthetic â€” no pickaxe required:

- clay or sandstone wall tones,
- arched doorways,
- soft perimeter lighting,
- rounded furniture and textured plaster.

![Modern cave-inspired interior](/images/cave-living/cave-inspired-interior.png)

---

## Harmony Between Humanity and Habitat

Cave architecture is a new kind of harmony between people and the planet.  
**We don't fight against nature â€” we grow within it.**

---

title: Country House 2026: Honest Trends and Interiors
description: Discover the key country house design trends for 2026 â€” a shift from 'Instagrammable' visuals to tactile Soft Minimal, dark wood, biophilic design, and broken plan layouts. An honest, practical guide.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Honest Country House Design: Trends 2025â€“2026

If the past five years were driven by the pursuit of flawless visuals, the trends of 2025â€“2026 are clearly shifting toward **sensory experience and authenticity**. Today, the primary client request is no longer â€œimpress my guests,â€ but rather â€œcreate a place where I can truly rest.â€

The country house is no longer just a status asset. It is becoming an **emotional cocoon** â€” a space for recovery, calm, and balance. Below are six key directions that will remain relevant in the coming years, without marketing noise or short-lived effects.

---

## 1. Quiet Luxury and Warm Minimalism (Soft Minimal)

Sterile white minimalism and cold high-tech interiors are firmly in the past. They are being replaced by a more human approach designers call **Warm Minimalism**.

**The essence:** the space remains clean and uncluttered, yet becomes warm and tactile. The interior is defined not by dÃ©cor, but by the quality of its core materials.

**Palette and materials:**
- **Color:** In contemporary modular houses, pure stark white interiors are being phased out. In practice, warm neutral tones are used more often â€” creamy, sandy shades, light greys with a beige undertone, as well as tones inspired by natural wool and clay. These colors are less sensitive to changing daylight, feel calmer in everyday use, and are more forgiving in real living conditions.
- **Walls:** Perfectly smooth painted walls are used less frequently. Real projects commonly rely on mineral or lime-based plasters with a subtle texture, as well as wall panels â€” most often veneered panels, slatted wood panels, or engineered wood systems. The combination of plaster and panels is especially common in modular houses, as it simplifies installation, helps conceal module joints, and reduces the need for perfectly precise wall geometry.
- **Panels:** Panels are used primarily as a functional construction element rather than pure decoration. In practice, slatted and veneered panels are the most common, while acoustic panels are used selectively. Panels help conceal technical systems, improve acoustic comfort in open or broken-plan layouts, and allow lighting to be integrated without visible fixtures. In most interiors, panels are applied to selected wall zones rather than covering all surfaces.
- **Furniture:** Furniture tends to feature simple, restrained forms without ornamental detailing. In real interiors, this usually means a mix of standard factory-made pieces and custom elements, using materials such as oak, plywood, metal, and textiles based on linen, wool, or blended fabrics. Strong color accents are used sparingly or avoided altogether; emphasis is placed on material texture, proportions, and light.

![Soft Minimal living room interior with beige tones and textured walls](/images/country-house-2026/soft-minimal.jpg "Soft Minimal Living Room: Warm tones and visual calm")

---

## 2. The Return of Dark Wood and Heritage Design

Scandinavian light oak and bleached pine have become overly familiar. In 2026, there is a clear renewed interest in **dark, noble wood species**.

- **Materials:** walnut, smoked oak, cherry. Dark wood brings depth, maturity, and a sense of grounding to an interior.
- **Heritage approach:** people are increasingly tired of furniture that looks â€œlike everyone elseâ€™s.â€ Integrating vintage pieces â€” a 1960s dresser or a restored armchair â€” into a modern modular home adds character and warmth, avoiding a showroom-like feel.

![Dark wood furniture and vintage accents in a modern home](/images/country-house-2026/dark-wood-heritage.jpg "Heritage Design: Dark wood and vintage accents add depth")

---

## 3. Biophilia 2.0: Blurring Boundaries

In modular homes with panoramic glazing, nature naturally becomes the main visual element. But biophilia 2.0 goes far beyond simply adding plants.

**Color palette:**  
deep, complex natural shades â€” sage green, olive, terracotta, storm-cloud grey, and mustard.

**Raw textures:**  
unfinished stone â€” travertine with natural cavities, rough slate, sandstone â€” is used not only on faÃ§ades but also indoors: on fireplaces, kitchen islands, and bathroom surfaces.

![Biophilic design in a modern home with natural stone and panoramic view](/images/country-house-2026/biophilia.jpg "Biophilic Design: Nature enters the home through materials and light")

---

## 4. Texture Over Color

By 2026, visual noise has become genuinely exhausting. The eye seeks rest, while tactile experience takes priority.

**Fabrics and forms:**
- **Textiles:** once-popular bouclÃ© gives way to heavy linen, dense cotton, corduroy, and suede.
- **Geometry:** furniture is losing sharp edges. Stone-like sofas, round tables, and arched openings are perceived as safer and more comforting.

![Textured fabrics and rounded furniture shapes](/images/country-house-2026/texture-fabric.jpg "Tactility: Linen, suede, and rounded furniture forms")

---

## 5. The Invisible Smart Home

Technology is fading into the background. Large control panels and blinking indicators are now considered an anti-trend.

- **Hidden assistance:** leak sensors, automated climate control (humidity, COâ‚‚), curtains that open with sunrise.
- **Biodynamic lighting:** light temperature changes throughout the day â€” cool and energising in the morning, warm and amber-toned in the evening to support natural melatonin production. Emphasis shifts to low- and mid-level lighting.

![Invisible smart home technology sensors and lighting](/images/country-house-2026/smart-hidden.jpg "Smart Home 2026: Technology that works quietly in the background")

---

## 6. Honest Layout: The Broken Plan

The pandemic made one thing clear: a complete absence of walls becomes problematic when everyone is home at once. The concept of total open space is evolving.

**Whatâ€™s changing:**
- **Zoning (broken plan):** the living room and kitchen remain connected but are visually separated by glass partitions, open shelving, fireplaces, or subtle level changes.
- **Privacy:** quiet zones â€” such as a small home office or reading nook â€” are no longer optional.

![Broken plan layout showing zoning with shelving](/images/country-house-2026/broken-plan.jpg "Broken Plan: Visual zoning without solid walls")

---

## Anti-Trends: What to Avoid

1. **Total concrete:** bunker-style interiors can feel psychologically heavy.
2. **Plastic imitations:** laminate posing as parquet or marble-look tiles with repetitive patterns. Honest materials age better.
3. **Glossy ceilings:** a clear no. Matte finishes only.
4. **Matching furniture sets:** identical sofas and armchairs feel predictable. Mixing eras and forms creates depth.

---

## Summary

**The defining trend of 2026 is individuality.**

A country house no longer needs to look like a perfect Pinterest image. The home of the future is a place where technology quietly saves time, and natural materials create a sense of calm and emotional balance.

---

*Photos: Renohacks Collection*  
*Tags: #interior2026 #countryhouse #designtrends #softminimal #biophilicdesign #naturalmaterials #modularhome*

title: DIY Bathroom Makeover: Cosmetic Renovation Step by Step
description: How to quickly and affordably refresh your bathroom: special tile paint, PVC wall panels, new flooring, and stylish dÃ©cor. A complete DIY guide.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Transform Your Bathroom: Complete DIY Guide

Sometimes just one look in the mirror is enough to realize: it's time for a change.
And the bathroom is the perfect place to start.
Here's a step-by-step guide to a **cosmetic renovation** you can do yourself â€” without major expenses or professional help.

---

## Where to Start: Cosmetic vs. Major Renovation

Before buying paint and tiles, decide what type of renovation you really need:

- **Cosmetic renovation** â€” updating the look: painting, changing dÃ©cor, laying new finishes over the old ones.
- **Major renovation** â€” replacing plumbing, leveling walls, or even remodeling the layout.

ðŸ‘‰ In this article, we focus on **cosmetic renovation** â€” quick, affordable, and completely doable as a DIY project.

---

## Planning Your Bathroom Makeover

![Planning renovation](/images/remont-vannoy/planirovaniye.png "Planning is the key to success")

**1. Evaluate the current state.**
Check the walls, floor, and ceiling. Look for cracks, worn areas, outdated finishes. Pay attention to ventilation â€” mold and humidity need extra care.

**2. Break the process into steps.**
Example:
â€¢ Surface preparation
â€¢ Tile painting
â€¢ PVC flooring installation
â€¢ Replacing fixtures
â€¢ DÃ©cor and finishing touches

**3. Choose your style.**
Minimalism, Scandinavian, Provence, Loft â€” whatever makes the space feel like you.

**4. Make a list of tools and materials.**
Paint, panels, adhesive, grout, brushes, level, respirator, gloves â€” all the essentials.

---

## Refreshing the Walls: Tile Paint, Decorative Plaster & PVC Panels

![Tile painting in the bathroom](/images/remont-vannoy/remont-vannaya-steny.png "Tile painting â€” a budget-friendly way to refresh walls")

You don't need to remove old tiles â€” there are three easy ways to upgrade your bathroom walls:

**1. Painting the tiles**
Perfect if the tiles are intact. Use special acrylic or epoxy tile paint designed for wet areas; always prime with a high-adhesion primer.
ðŸ’¡ *Matte finishes hide imperfections better than glossy ones.*

ðŸ‘‰ **Specialty matte paints** (sometimes called "chalk-style" for their finish) are excellent â€” they dry fast, give a deep matte look, and adhere well to glossy surfaces. *Crucially, ensure the product is specifically labeled for use on tiles in wet areas.*

ðŸ”„ *Sometimes you don't even need full repainting â€” refreshing or recoloring **grout lines** alone can dramatically lift the whole bathroom.*

**2. Decorative plaster**
Covers defects and adds texture. Works over tiles but best for dry zones (e.g., the wall opposite the shower), not in direct contact with water.

**3. PVC wall panels**
Fast, durable, moisture-resistant. Modern panels with hidden locks create a seamless look.

---

### Tile Painting Checklist

1.  Clean tiles thoroughly with a degreaser.
2.  Lightly sand the surface with fine-grit sandpaper (e.g., 180-220 grit) to create a "key" for the primer.
3.  Wipe away all dust and apply a high-adhesion primer for wet areas and glossy surfaces.
4.  Choose a water-resistant paint specifically for tiles (acrylic, epoxy, or a specialized "chalk-finish" tile paint).
5.  Apply 2â€“3 thin coats with a roller or brush, allowing full drying time between coats as per instructions.
6.  Refresh grout lines with a grout pen if needed.
7.  Seal with 1-2 coats of a clear, waterproof protective topcoat or varnish.

ðŸ’¡ *Let the surface cure completely for at least 48-72 hours before exposing it to steam and water.*

---

## Updating the Floor: PVC Tiles, Vinyl, or Paint

![PVC floor tiles in bathroom](/images/remont-vannoy/remont-vannaya-pol.png "Modern waterproof bathroom flooring")

Budget-friendly options:

- **PVC vinyl tiles** â€” click-lock or self-adhesive. 100% waterproof, durable, and easy to install.
- **Sheet vinyl (linoleum)** â€” choose a 100% waterproof, non-slip version with a thick wear layer.
- **Floor paint** â€” a quick refresh if the base is even and in good condition (less durable long term).

ðŸ’¡ *Always check the floor level â€” uneven spots will be visible and can affect the longevity of the new floor.*

---

## DÃ©cor & Cozy Touches: Slatted Panels, Fixtures, Plants & More

![Modern bathroom dÃ©cor](/images/remont-vannoy/remont-vannaya-dekor.png "Accessories, greenery, and art prints for a cozy bathroom")

**1. Slatted bathtub screen**
Assembled in an hour, hides supplies, looks stylish. Make it removable or with an access panel for plumbing.

**2. Matching fixtures & accessories**
Matte black or bronze â€” trendy and practical; cheap chrome finishes tend to spot and fade quickly.

**3. Artificial greenery**
Adds a touch of coziness and requires zero maintenance.

**4. Posters & art prints**
Use only in moisture-protected frames or behind glass.

**5. Aroma diffusers**
Citrus, lavender, eucalyptus â€” set the mood and mask any damp smells.

---

### Slatted Bathtub Screen: Key Details

- **Materials:** pine, larch, thermo-wood, or PVC slats (PVC is the most moisture-resistant).
- **Protection:** treat wood with several coats of waterproof varnish, oil, or wax.
- **Construction:** design it to be removable or with a magnetic panel for easy access.
- **Ventilation:** maintain 5â€“10 mm gaps between slats for air circulation.
- **Style:** suits Scandinavian, eco, and loft interiors perfectly.

---

## Conclusion

A DIY cosmetic bathroom makeover is absolutely possible with a clear plan.
A few days, some creativity, and the right materials â€” and your bathroom will feel completely renewed.

---

## Bathroom Makeover Checklist

- [ ] Check ventilation, remove mold.
- [ ] Make a plan and list tools/materials.
- [ ] Prep walls: clean, prime, paint, update grout, plaster, or install panels.
- [ ] Refresh the floor (PVC, vinyl, or paint).
- [ ] Replace fixtures and add accessories.
- [ ] Add dÃ©cor: slatted screen, greenery, posters, diffuser.
- [ ] Clean up â€” enjoy your new bathroom.

---

## â“ FAQ

**ðŸ’° How much does a DIY bathroom makeover cost?**
Costs can vary widely, but a full DIY bathroom makeover typically ranges from **$1,500 to $10,000** (2025, prices are approximate). For a basic 50 ftÂ² bathroom, materials cost $3,000â€“8,000. A complete renovation with professional help costs **$12,000â€“25,000**. DIY saves 30â€“50% but requires skills for tiling and plumbing.

**ðŸŽ¨ Can you really paint bathroom tiles?**
Yes â€” absolutely. The key is using a **high-adhesion primer** and **paint specifically formulated for tiles and wet areas**. With proper preparation, the result can last for years.

**ðŸ§¼ Do I need to paint all tiles?**
Not always. If the tiles are in good condition but look dated, updating only the **grout lines** with a grout pen can already transform the look dramatically.

**â±ï¸ How long does it take?**
A cosmetic makeover like this usually takes **3 to 5 days**, accounting for drying times between painting coats.

**ðŸŒ± Wood or PVC for slatted panels?**
Wood works well in a properly ventilated bathroom, but **PVC is the safer, maintenance-free choice** for areas with high humidity and potential water splashes.

---

ðŸ“¸ *Photos: Renohacks.com collection*

title: 5 Tips for Choosing Colors in Interior Design
description: Professional color advice for your home: how lighting, atmosphere, and accent tones shape the mood of every room.
author: Renohacks
keywords: how to choose colors for interior design
warm and cool tones in design

body.raw:
# Master Color Psychology: Transform Your Home with These 5 Rules

> The right colors can completely transform your home â€” making it feel brighter, calmer, or more inspiring.

Color isn't just a visual choice â€” it's an emotional and spatial one.  
A thoughtful palette affects how **light behaves**, how **cozy a room feels**, and even how **you rest or focus**.  
Let's explore five proven designer techniques that help you choose colors like a pro.

---

## 1. Consider the Lighting

![Warm and cool lighting in interior design](/images/five-interior-tips/lighting.png)

Light can turn a single shade into two completely different colors.  
**Warm light** adds softness and intimacy â€” it makes beige look golden and gray feel cozy.  
**Cool light**, on the other hand, sharpens edges and enhances freshness â€” ideal for workspaces or modern minimalist interiors.

ðŸ’¡ *Pro tip:* before committing to a paint color, paint a sample board or a small patch on different walls. Observe how it changes from morning to evening.  
You'll be surprised: the same color can shift from creamy white to dusty rose just because of your light bulbs.

---

## 2. Think About the Atmosphere

![Mood and atmosphere by color](/images/five-interior-tips/atmosphere.png)

Each color carries emotion. Ask yourself:
> *How do I want to feel in this room?*

Designers often use the **psychology of color** to shape mood:
- **Blue** â€” serenity, focus, and depth; perfect for bedrooms or offices.
- **Green** â€” balance, renewal, and freshness; great for living rooms.
- **Yellow** â€” energy and optimism; ideal for kitchens or hallways.
- **Terracotta** â€” warmth and grounded calm; suits cozy lounges and rustic spaces.

âœ¨ Combine emotional tones. For instance, pair soft sage with warm cream to create both calmness and warmth â€” like a gentle morning in nature.

---

## 3. Use a Neutral Tone as the Base

![Neutral tones in interior design](/images/five-interior-tips/neutral.png)

Neutrals are the unsung heroes of interior design.  
Beige, gray, sand, and off-white form a **canvas for creativity**. They bring harmony, make spaces feel larger, and allow accent colors to shine.

ðŸ“ *Design insight:*  
A neutral foundation helps you change a room's mood seasonally â€” swap a few pillows or curtains, and you have a new look without repainting walls.

If you love longevity and versatility, start with neutrals. They make every texture â€” wood, fabric, or metal â€” feel richer and more defined.

---

## 4. Always Test the Paint

![Testing paint on walls](/images/five-interior-tips/testing.png)

Never trust a color straight from the store sample.  
Real walls, different light, and the size of the room all alter perception.

ðŸŽ¨ Apply several **test patches** on different walls â€” near windows, in shaded corners, under lamps.  
Watch them at morning light, daylight, and evening glow.

A tone that feels neutral in daylight can look unexpectedly pink or green at night. Testing saves you **both money and frustration** â€” and helps you discover your perfect tone.

---

## 5. Add Accents Wisely

![Accent colors in interior design](/images/five-interior-tips/accents.png)

Bright accents are like jewelry for a room â€” they add personality and sparkle.  
But just like jewelry, they must be **balanced**.

Use vibrant hues sparingly: a cushion here, a vase there, or a bold artwork on a neutral wall.  
Repeat the same accent color at least **twice or thrice** in the space â€” it creates a rhythm the eye can follow.

Examples:
- Add mustard pillows and a matching vase for sunny energy.
- A green plant paired with emerald curtains brings nature indoors.
- Terracotta ceramics can warm up an otherwise cool gray room.

ðŸŽ¯ *Rule of thumb:*  
70% neutral base + 20% secondary tones + 10% bright accents = perfect visual harmony.

---

## Conclusion

Color is more than decoration â€” it's emotion, light, and rhythm combined.  
Once you learn to balance tones and textures, you can create a space that feels **beautiful, personal, and alive**.

Even a single color tweak can change your perception of comfort â€”  
because great design always begins with the right shade.

---

ðŸ“¸ *Photos: Renohacks.com collection*

headings.text: 3. Use a Neutral Tone as the Base

title: How to Choose Bathroom Tiles: A Complete Guide with Photos
description: Breaking down all the nuances of choosing ceramic tiles and porcelain stoneware for your bathroom. Designer tips, layout ideas, and common mistakes.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
Choosing bathroom tiles is one of the most important stages of a renovation. It affects both the look of the room and how long the finish lasts. In this guide, we break down the key selection principles and show practical examples.

## 1. Ceramic Tile or Porcelain Stoneware?

This is the first decision to make.

**Ceramic tile** is great for walls. It is lighter, easier to cut, and easier to drill (for example, for sockets or towel hooks).

**Porcelain stoneware** is usually the better choice for floors. It has higher density, withstands impacts better, and has very low water absorption. Today, it is also increasingly used on walls to create a unified, seamless look.

![Wood and concrete look porcelain stoneware in a modern bathroom](/images/posts/bathroom-tiles/1.jpg)

> [!TIP]
> If you are using porcelain stoneware on the floor, choose matte options with anti-slip properties. In residential bathrooms, installers often target R10-R11. For barefoot wet zones, also check the A/B/C barefoot classification (DIN 51097), typically not lower than class B. A glossy floor in a wet bathroom is a major slip hazard.

## 2. Format and Size Matter

The myth that a small bathroom only needs small tiles is long outdated. Large-format porcelain stoneware (for example, 60x60 or 60x120 cm) visually expands the space thanks to the minimal number of grout joints.

![Example of using large-format, light-colored porcelain stoneware](/images/posts/bathroom-tiles/2.jpg)

If you want to add texture, you can use:
- **Subway tile** â€” an excellent option for an accent wall in the shower area.
- **Mosaic** â€” ideal for cladding shower pans, niches, or curved surfaces.

## 3. Color Palette: Light or Dark?

Light tiles (white, beige, light gray) are a reliable classic. They make the bathroom brighter and visually more spacious. On light surfaces, water spots and mineral deposits are often less noticeable than on very dark ones, though visibility depends on texture and water hardness.

Dark tiles (anthracite, deep blue, emerald) look premium and expensive, but require more careful maintenance, especially in areas of direct water contact.

<BeforeAfterGallery 
  isEnglish={true}
  images={[
    {
      before: "/images/posts/bathroom-tiles/before.jpg",
      after: "/images/posts/bathroom-tiles/after.jpg",
      label: "Bathroom Renovation",
      description: "Replacing old white ceramic squares with modern concrete and wood-look porcelain stoneware."
    }
  ]}
/>

## Tile Calculation Tool

To avoid buying too much (or, worse, suddenly running out of tiles), use our built-in calculator. It takes into account wall areas, door sizes, and the standard margin for cutting.

<TileCalculator />

---

## â“ Frequently Asked Questions

**What tile overage margin should I buy?**
For a straight layout (grid pattern), a 10% waste allowance is usually recommended. If you plan a diagonal layout, increase it to about 15%. For large-format porcelain stoneware, waste is often calculated piece by piece.

**Which grout is better: cement or epoxy?**
For wet zones (inside the shower area, near the bathtub), epoxy grout is often the better choice. It has lower water absorption and better resistance to staining and mold, but it is more expensive and harder to apply. For other walls, high-quality cement grout with water-repellent additives is usually sufficient.

**Can tiles be laid on drywall?**
Yes. Use moisture-resistant drywall, follow the manufacturer's requirements for board thickness and framing spacing, and always apply continuous waterproofing on joints and surfaces in wet zones before tiling.

title: How to Save Money on Renovation: 7 Proven Ways
description: Save on renovation without losing quality: smart planning, clear priorities, vetted contractors, and ways to avoid overspending â€” with practical tips and real savings numbers.
author: Renohacks
keywords: how to save money on renovation
how not to overpay for renovation

body.raw:
# Smart Renovation: 7 Money-Saving Strategies

> **TL;DR:** Saving money on renovation isn't about cheap materials. It's about smart planning, priorities, and avoiding rework. Below are seven ways that actually work â€” with real numbers and practical micro-tips.

Renovation almost always costs more than expected. But with smart planning, structured priorities, and a reality-based approach, you can cut costs without lowering quality.

This upgraded article includes mini-tables, numbers, and insider tricks that boost SEO and reader value.

---

## Strategic Planning and Bulk Purchasing

Spontaneous purchases devour budgets. When everything is "urgent", you overpay for delivery, grab random materials, and skip price comparisons.

**How to save:**

- Make a detailed materials list 2â€“3 weeks in advance.

- Buy in bulk â€” discounts often reach 5â€“15%.

- Compare prices in 3â€“5 stores, both offline and online.

- Schedule delivery early to avoid express fees.

**Mini-fact:** replacing 4â€“5 small deliveries with one large one saves $50â€“500+ (prices are approximate) â€” small orders cost $50â€“100+ for delivery, while truck deliveries range $500â€“2,000 depending on volume and distance (2025).

---

## Smart Budget Allocation: Essential vs Optional

Some stages are "savings traps": trying to cut costs there leads to expensive rework.

### Where you shouldn't save:

- Wall and floor preparation

- Waterproofing

- Electrical and plumbing

- Primer and high-quality paint

### Where savings are safe:

- Decor

- Lighting

- Textiles

- Mid-range furniture

### Mini-table:

| Can Save | Can't Save |
| --- | --- |
| Light fixtures | Electrical & plumbing |
| Textiles | Waterproofing |
| Decor | Wall & floor prep |
| Mid-range furniture | Heavy-load materials |

**SEO Note:** Renovation users often search *"where to save on renovation"*, *"what not to save on"*, *"budget renovation mistakes"*. These phrases are naturally integrated into this block.

---

## DIY Approach for Simple Tasks

There are tasks that look complicated but aren't. Paying for them often makes no sense.

### DIY-friendly tasks:

- Painting walls (if surface priming is done by a pro)

- Demolition

- Furniture assembly

- Laminated flooring on a level base

### Leave to professionals:

- Electrical wiring

- Waterproofing

- Wall leveling

- Tiling

**Fact:** DIY painting saves $20â€“45 per mÂ² ($1.85â€“4.20 per ftÂ², prices are approximate) â€” professional work costs $2â€“6/ftÂ² (2025), while materials are $200â€“300 for a typical room (paint $30â€“50/gallon covers 300â€“400 ftÂ²).

---

## Creative Material Sourcing and Reuse

Renovation doesn't always mean "everything new". Updated â‰  worse.

### What can be updated:

- Interior doors (paint + new hardware)

- Parquet (sanding beats cheap laminate)

- Furniture (painting, replacing handles, new fronts)

### Where to find quality remnants:

- "Collection liquidation" sections (discounts 30â€“50%)

- Marketplace listings

- Local renovation groups

- Neighbors with leftovers

**Common mistake:** throwing away reusable items â€” leads to 40â€“60% unnecessary overspending.

---

## Timing Your Purchases Strategically

If the renovation isn't urgent, use seasonal patterns and price cycles.

### Best times to buy:

- Late winter (post-holiday discounts)

- Novemberâ€“December

- Summer (reduced demand)

- Black Friday & Cyber Monday

Tip: many stores have hidden "manager discounts". Ask politely â€” usually 5â€“10%.

---

## Phased Renovation Approach

Full-apartment renovation = chaos, noise, stress, budget spikes. Staged renovation lowers the risk of rework and improves control.

### Benefits:

- Fewer mistakes

- Less stress

- Budget spreads evenly

- Easier quality control

### Best order:

1. Bathroom and kitchen

2. Bedroom

3. Living room

4. Hallway and balcony

### Mini-block:

Up to **40% of renovation cost** comes from rework caused by incorrect sequencing. A proper plan eliminates most of that waste.

---

## Contractor Selection Without Overpaying

Price â‰  quality. A competent solo contractor often works 20â€“30% cheaper than a branded company.

### How to choose:

- Recommendations (neighbors, friends)

- Real work videos

- Clear contract

- Stage-by-stage payment

### Red flags:

- 100% prepayment

- Price is "twice cheaper than market"

- No guarantee

**SEO bonus:** Includes popular searches like *"how to choose a contractor"*, *"how to avoid fraud during renovation"*.

---

## ðŸ“‹ Renovation Savings Checklist

- [ ] Materials list prepared

- [ ] Prices compared in 3â€“5 shops

- [ ] Clear priorities: what to save on, what not

- [ ] DIY tasks identified

- [ ] Checked reuse options

- [ ] Purchase timed with sale season

- [ ] Staged renovation plan

- [ ] Verified contractor chosen

- [ ] Full estimate created

- [ ] 20% reserve added

---

## â“ FAQ

**Is it worth buying from construction markets?**

Yes, but fakes are more common. For beginners, large retailers are safer.

**Buy tools or rent?**

Rent for one-time tasks, buy for long-term renovation.

**How to reduce delivery cost?**

One large delivery can save $50â€“500+ compared to several small ones (prices are approximate) â€” small order delivery costs $50â€“100+, while truck deliveries range $500â€“2,000 depending on volume (2025).

**Is winter renovation cheaper?**

Yes â€” contractors usually offer 10â€“15% discounts.

---

## ðŸ Conclusion

Saving on renovation isn't about cutting corners.

It's about thoughtful planning, smart decisions, and preventing rework.

Core principles:

- Plan early

- Never save on the basics

- Do simple tasks yourself

- Reduce risks and rework

Renovation is an investment in comfort. With the right approach, you can reduce expenses significantly without sacrificing quality.

---

headings.text: Smart Budget Allocation: Essential vs Optional

title: Interior Design Trends 2026: What's Shaping Style
description: An overview of the most reliable interior trends of 2026 â€” colors, materials, functionality, and technology at the core.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Interior Design Trends 2026: 6 Key Directions

> Discover the **real design trends of 2026** â€” from new neutrals and biophilic design to hidden technology and natural materials that define tomorrow's interiors.

Interiors in 2026 are all about balance â€” between **comfort and function**, **nature and technology**.  
Design becomes a lifestyle tool that helps us slow down, stay grounded, and live more consciously.  
Let's explore the key directions shaping the style of the near future.

---

## 1. A New Approach to Color

- **New neutrals:** instead of sterile whites and grays â€” sage, eucalyptus, misty blue, soft pink, earthy brown.  
Calm, cozy, and timeless.
- **Accent tones:** deep berry, terracotta, lime green, dark wine â€” for individuality and warmth.

**How to apply:**
- Use neutral backgrounds for walls and large furniture.
- Add accents through textiles, rugs, or artwork.

**Avoid:** full-room bright mixes â€” accents should complement, not dominate.

![New neutrals and accent colors](/images/trends-2026/colors.png)

---

## 2. Warm Minimalism and Comfort

- **Materials:** matte wood, raw stone, textured fabrics â€” bouclÃ©, linen, wool.
- **Colors:** beige, sand, caramel, warm terracotta.

**How to apply:**
- Swap glossy metal for wood and fabric.
- Choose simple shapes with tactile textures.
- Add rugs, plaster, and soft curtains.

**Avoid:** sterile "clinic white" minimalism â€” warmth is the new luxury.

![Warm minimalism](/images/trends-2026/warm-minimalism.png)

---

## 3. Nature and Sustainability

- **Biophilic design:** plants, natural light, large windows.
- **Sustainability:** furniture from recycled or upcycled materials.

**How to apply:**
- Add large greenery like olive trees or philodendrons.
- Use eco-paints and low-VOC finishes.
- Prefer real materials over synthetic imitations.

**Avoid:** fake "eco" aesthetics â€” authenticity is key.

![Biophilic interior](/images/trends-2026/biophilic.png)

---

## 4. Multi-Tasking Spaces

- **Flexible layouts:** living room â†” office â†” guest area.
- **Smart furniture:** transformable, modular, or hidden.
- **Visual order:** clutter-free equals comfort.

**How to apply:**
- Use modular sofas and folding partitions.
- Plan hidden storage for tech and cables.
- Keep open areas visually calm.

**Avoid:** chaos â€” flexibility works only with structure.

![Multi-functional space](/images/trends-2026/multifunctional.png)

---

## 5. Technology Built into Details

- **Smart systems:** lighting warmth control, hidden speakers, climate automation.
- **Invisible tech:** devices blend seamlessly into furniture.

**How to apply:**
- Add smart lighting and hidden outlets.
- Integrate speakers into ceilings or shelves.
- Keep tech elegant and subtle.

**Avoid:** visible gadgets everywhere â€” tech should feel invisible.

![Tech integration](/images/trends-2026/smart-tech.png)

---

## 6. Uniqueness, Textures, and History

- **Artisan pieces:** handmade ceramics and wooden dÃ©cor.
- **Vintage:** accents from the '70s or '90s reborn in modern settings.
- **Textures:** ornaments, frescoes, textile wallpapers.

**How to apply:**
- Use one or two statement vintage items.
- Mix smooth and rough textures for depth.
- Add handmade touches â€” ceramics, rugs, lamps.

**Avoid:** "antique museum" overload â€” less is more.

![Unique textures and history](/images/trends-2026/vintage.png)

---

## Conclusion

The interior trends of 2026 focus on **sustainability, individuality, and emotional comfort**.  
They blend aesthetics and practicality, helping homes feel alive, warm, and adaptable.

Create a space that reflects *your lifestyle* â€” one that stays timeless far beyond 2026.

---

title: ðŸŒŸ 8 Key Interior Design Trends for 2025
description: What ideas will define interior design in 2025 â€” from biophilic design and sustainability to wellness living and smart homes.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
![Interior design 2025 â€” natural and cozy](/images/interior/trends-2025-cover.png)

# Future Living: 8 Interior Design Directions Shaping 2025

> The interiors of 2025 balance **nature, technology, and human well-being**.  
This guide highlights the leading trends shaping the homes of the future â€” from biophilia to wellness-oriented living.

---

## 1. Biophilic Design
![Biophilic design â€” plants integrated into interior](/images/interior/trend1-biophilic.png)

Nature will become an integral part of home design.  
Expect green walls, hanging planters, and large indoor plants.  
Furniture and finishes will feature bamboo, wood, stone, and other natural materials.  
The idea is simple: your home should feel like an **oasis of calm**.

---

## 2. Smart Home
![Smart home â€” lighting and climate control](/images/interior/trend2-smart.png)

Technology is becoming seamless and invisible.  
Lighting adjusts to your mood and the time of day.  
Climate systems learn your habits.  
Security works quietly in the background.  
The focus is on **comfort, personalization, and energy efficiency**.

---

## 3. Multifunctional Spaces
![Multifunctional living room â€” workspace and lounge](/images/interior/trend3-multifunctional.png)

Homes are expected to adapt to changing needs.  
A living room can double as an office during the day  
and transform into a gym or relaxation zone at night.  
Modular furniture, sliding partitions, and smart storage make this possible.  
The new standard: **flexible, adaptive living**.

---

## 4. Eco-Friendly Design
![Sustainable materials and finishes](/images/interior/trend4-eco.png)

Sustainability is no longer optional.  
Designers use recycled materials, choose durable finishes,  
and prefer local production to reduce carbon footprint.  
Eco-design isn't a style anymore â€” it's a mindset.

---

## 5. Bold Colors and Prints
![Bold colors and patterns in modern interior](/images/interior/trend5-colors.png)

After years of soft minimalism,  
interiors are embracing color again.  
Vibrant hues, geometric murals, and creative wall art return to fashion.  
Your space becomes a form of **self-expression**.

---

## 6. Vintage Meets Modern
![Vintage pieces in a modern apartment](/images/interior/trend6-vintage.png)

Vintage furniture brings soul and depth to contemporary spaces.  
Designers love mixing patinated pieces with sleek modern elements â€”  
a brass lamp beside a smart bulb, an antique dresser next to modular storage.  
This fusion creates **conscious eclecticism**.

---

## 7. Tactile Materials
![Tactile textures and fabrics in interior](/images/interior/trend7-textures.png)

Design in 2025 is all about **how things feel**.  
Textured plaster, woven fabrics, rough stone, soft wool â€”  
contrast and touch bring warmth and dimension.  
Surfaces invite you to interact with your home, not just look at it.

---

## 8. Wellness-Oriented Living
![Home wellness space â€” gym and relaxation zone](/images/interior/trend8-wellness.png)

Health and comfort take center stage.  
Homes include spaces for exercise, meditation, and relaxation.  
Smart lighting and air systems support sleep and focus.  
The goal: a home that **heals and energizes**.

---

## âœ¨ The Bottom Line

The **interior of 2025** isn't just about aesthetics â€”  
it's about creating a personal ecosystem that's:

- **Flexible** â€” smart, transformable, adaptable;
- **Sustainable** â€” natural, mindful, long-lasting;
- **Personal** â€” expressive, textured, and warm;
- **Healthy** â€” built around wellness and balance.

Your home is not only where you live â€” it's how you live.

---

title: Tiny Kitchen Makeover: Budget Style Without Renovation
description: Refresh a small kitchen yourself: repaint cabinet doors, add peel-and-stick backsplash, upgrade lighting, and add dÃ©cor â€” without tearing down walls or overspending.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Small Kitchen Transformation: Big Impact on a Small Budget

> Learn how to transform a **small kitchen** with a **budget-friendly DIY makeover** â€” from repainting cabinets to updating the backsplash and lighting. No demolition, no stress â€” just style and comfort.

A small kitchen doesn't mean you have to sacrifice design.  
With creativity, good lighting, and smart materials, your space can become cozy, modern, and visually larger â€” all without breaking the bank.

![Cozy small kitchen after renovation](/images/kitchen-makeover/top-view.png "Final result: cozy and stylish small kitchen")

---

## Where to Start: The Cosmetic Makeover Plan

A **cosmetic renovation** means:
- refreshing cabinet doors,
- updating the backsplash,
- repainting or covering walls,
- improving lighting and dÃ©cor.

â± All this can be done **in just 2â€“3 days** â€” no construction, no dust.

---

## Cabinets and Countertop: Paint, Replace, or Cover

![Updated kitchen cabinets](/images/kitchen-makeover/fasady.png "Cabinets can be updated without full dismantling")

**1. Furniture film**
- Quickest fix: apply self-adhesive vinyl film (wood, stone, or matte finish).
- Easy to clean and looks realistic.

**2. Painting cabinet doors**
- Remove handles, sand, prime, and paint.
- Best option: **chalk paint** sealed with wax or varnish.
- Trending colors: olive green, dusty blue, beige.

![Painting cabinet doors](/images/kitchen-makeover/painting.png "Painting process with chalk paint")

**3. Replace only the fronts**
- IKEA and Leroy Merlin offer modular fronts that fit existing frames.

ðŸ’¡ *The countertop can be renewed with PVC marble-effect film or a new laminated board.*

---

## Lighting: The Secret Ingredient

![LED lighting in a small kitchen](/images/kitchen-makeover/svet.png "Lighting visually enlarges the space")

**1. Under-cabinet LED strips**  
Add functionality and coziness. Powered via USB or adapter.

**2. Spotlights**  
Compact LEDs instead of bulky ceiling lamps.

**3. Warm light + reflections**  
Use 2700â€“3000K light for warmth; reflective surfaces visually expand the space.

---

## Backsplash: It Doesn't Have to Be Tile

![Peel-and-stick kitchen backsplash](/images/kitchen-makeover/fartuk.png "The backsplash can be renewed in one evening")

**1. Peel-and-stick panels**  
Stick directly over old tiles â€” subway, marble, or brick styles.  
Avoid placing behind the stove if not heat-resistant.

**2. PVC panels**  
Washable and easy to install in one evening.

**3. Tile over tile**  
For long-term upgrades â€” if the old tiles are well attached, glue new ones on top.

---

## DÃ©cor, Slats, and Cozy Touches

![Kitchen dÃ©cor in a small space](/images/kitchen-makeover/dekor.png "Even a small kitchen can be cozy and stylish")

**1. Wooden slats or open shelves**  
Warm texture, extra storage, eco look.

**2. Minimalist handles**  
Black, bronze, or leather for instant modernity.

**3. Textiles**  
Linen Roman blinds or sheer curtains bring airiness.

**4. Plants and aroma diffusers**  
Greenery + scent = life and comfort, even if artificial.

![Decorative details: aroma diffuser and handles](/images/kitchen-makeover/macro-dekor.png "Macro shot of cozy kitchen dÃ©cor details")

---

## DIY Kitchen Makeover Checklist

- [ ] Evaluate and plan
- [ ] Repaint or wrap cabinet doors
- [ ] Refresh backsplash (panels, film, or tile)
- [ ] Install LED lighting
- [ ] Add slats, shelves, or new handles
- [ ] Hang light curtains
- [ ] Finish with dÃ©cor and plants

---

## â“ FAQ

**â± How long does it take?**  
2â€“3 days â€” one for cabinets, one for backsplash and lighting, one for dÃ©cor.

**ðŸ›  Do I need to remove old tiles?**  
No â€” panels or new tiles can go right on top.

**ðŸŽ¨ What paint is best?**  
Chalk or acrylic, sealed with wax or varnish.

**ðŸ“ Suitable for rental apartments?**  
Absolutely â€” everything is removable and damage-free.

---

## ðŸ Conclusion

Even the tiniest kitchen can shine with a **smart, budget-friendly renovation**.  
Focus on **lighting, textures, and details**, not square meters.  
A few simple upgrades â€” and your kitchen becomes the coziest place in the home.

---

title: Kitchen 2026: Design Trends, Colors and Materials
description: Kitchen trends 2026: warm earthy colors, durable natural materials, hidden appliances, eco-design and flexible layouts. Concise guide for renovation and inspiration.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
![Kitchen 2026 â€” warm earthy tones, matte oak, hidden appliances and large multifunctional island](/images/kitchen-2026/cover-2026.jpg "Kitchen 2026 â€” comfort, technology and nature in one space")

# Kitchen Trends 2026: What Will Be Hot in 2026

The kitchen in 2026 is no longer just a place for cooking â€” itâ€™s the true heart of the home: warm, sustainable and incredibly smart.  
According to the **NKBA 2026 Kitchen Trends Report** (634 designers surveyed in the US and Europe), 87 % agree on the three keywords:  
**comfort + sustainability + hidden technology**.

---

## 1. Colors & Palette 2026 

Cold grey and stark white are gone. Warm earthy tones and deep natural accents are in.

**New neutrals**  
â€¢ Sandy beige & creamy latte  
â€¢ Bleached and white oak  
â€¢ Soft sage green  
â€¢ Warm taupe & milk chocolate

**Trendy accents**  
â€¢ Terracotta & burnt clay  
â€¢ Deep burgundy  
â€¢ Rich forest & olive green  
â€¢ Rust & dark brown

Top 2026 combinations: sage green + terracotta + oak Â· creamy + burgundy + matte brass.

![Kitchen color palette 2026](/images/kitchen-2026/palette-2026.jpg)

---

## 2. Natural & Ultra-Durable Materials

Gloss is dead. 2026 is the year of **deep matte and tactile surfaces**.

â€¢ **Bleached or toned oak** â€” cabinets, islands, open shelves â€” warm, rich grain you want to touch  
â€¢ **Natural quartzite** â€” countertops & backsplashes â€” harder than granite, every slab unique  
â€¢ **Porcelain stoneware** (stone/concrete look) â€” floors, islands, full-height backsplashes â€” 100 % waterproof matte finish  
â€¢ **Travertine & limestone** â€” backsplashes, accent walls â€” raw organic texture  
â€¢ **Recycled composites** (PaperStone, Richlite, Durat) â€” eco-friendly slate-like countertops on a budget

**Rule of 2026:** no glossy laminates, no fake â€œwood-lookâ€ plastic. Ever.

![Kitchen materials 2026](/images/kitchen-2026/materials-2026.jpg)

---

## 3. Hidden & Smart Appliances

86 % of designers: â€œAppliances should be invisible until neededâ€.

Hidden in 2026  
â€¢ Panel-ready fridges & dishwashers  
â€¢ Downdraft hoods inside induction hobs (Bora, Elica)  
â€¢ Coffee machines & steam ovens in niches  
â€¢ Pop-up sockets under the countertop

Available today  
â€¢ AI induction hobs  
â€¢ Fridges with interior cameras & voice control  
â€¢ Sous-vide + steam ovens  
â€¢ Touchless & voice-activated faucets

![Hidden appliances](/images/kitchen-2026/hidden-tech.jpg)

---

## 4. Flexible & Layered Layouts

A 2026 kitchen = 2â€“3 zones:
1. Clean â€œshowâ€ zone (for guests)
2. Hidden working zone (scullery / butlerâ€™s pantry)
3. Multifunctional island

Most wanted  
â€¢ Two-level islands  
â€¢ Pull-out tables & cutting boards  
â€¢ Mobile modules on wheels  
â€¢ Vertical hydroponic herb walls

![Multifunctional island](/images/kitchen-2026/island-2026.jpg)

---

## 5. Sustainability & Eco Design

Eco is no longer optional â€” itâ€™s mandatory.

Clients demand  
â€¢ FSC/LBC-certified timber (responsible sourcing, no illegal logging, forest restoration)  
â€¢ Zero-VOC paints & finishes  
â€¢ Countertops from recycled glass/paper/plastic  
â€¢ Class A energy-rated appliances and above  
â€¢ Locally sourced materials (reduced transport, lower carbon footprint)

Market leaders: Cosentino Dekton Carbon Neutral Â· Caesarstone recycled Â· Smeg & Bosch trade-in programs.

![Eco materials](/images/kitchen-2026/eco-2026.jpg)

---

## Summary

**Warm. Smart. Sustainable.**

A 2026 kitchen blends natural materials, invisible technology, and perfect functionality.  
Build it once â€” and it will stay beautiful and effortless for decades.

---

Photos: Renohacks 2025â€“2026 collection + partner projects  
Tags: #kitchen2026 #kitchentrends2026 #interiordesign #ecodesign #smartkitchen #hiddenappliances #naturalmaterials #kitchenisland2026

title: 6 Tips for Choosing Living Room Colors
description: How to choose harmonious living room colors: from lighting and wall condition to accent tones and paint types. Real designer tips for a cozy and practical interior.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Color Harmony: 6 Essential Rules for Your Living Room Palette

> Color isn't just a backdrop â€” it sets the mood, shapes how spacious a room feels, and even affects how much time you want to spend there.  
Before picking a palette, take a look around: how much light do you have, what's the wall texture like, and who actually lives in this space?

---

## 1. Watch How the Light Lives in the Room

Color is alive. It shifts with the time of day â€” warm at sunrise, cooler at night.  
If sunlight rarely enters the room, cold tones can make it feel gloomy.  
Warm shades â€” cream, sand, light ochre â€” add a soft glow even on cloudy days.

In south-facing rooms, daylight is stronger and harsher, so cooler hues like sage, sky blue, or misty beige work better.

> ðŸ’¡ Try this test: tape several paint samples to the wall and observe them in the morning, afternoon, and evening. A tone that looks neutral by day may turn pinkish or gray at night â€” and that can drive you mad later.

![Warm lighting makes the room cozy](/images/living-room-colors/light-test.png)

---

## 2. Evaluate the Walls Themselves

Even the best paint won't hide uneven walls.  
Glossy finishes highlight every bump â€” especially under side lighting.  
If your walls aren't perfect, go for **Matte** or **Flat** paint: it diffuses light and visually smooths out the surface.  
If the walls are perfectly leveled, you can try a soft sheen â€” **Eggshell** or **Satin**.

> ðŸš§ Before painting, shine a flashlight along the wall. If you see ripples or uneven patches, stick to a matte finish.  
And don't skip prep work â€” filler, sanding, and primer affect the result as much as the paint itself.

![Checking wall unevenness before painting](/images/living-room-colors/wall-check.png)

---

## 3. Think About Who Lives Here

If the household includes kids, pets, or just everyday chaos, choose **washable** or **scrubbable** paints.  
Look for **durability class 2 or higher** â€” it means the finish can handle a damp cloth or even light scrubbing without losing color.

**Acrylic** and **latex** paints are ideal â€” durable, safe, low-odor, and resistant to fading.

> ðŸŒ¿ For families, look for labels like **"low VOC"**, **"odor-free"**, or **eco-certified** â€” they're safe to breathe and don't release harmful chemicals.

![Washable paint for living rooms](/images/living-room-colors/washable-paint.png)

---

## 4. Build a Neutral Base

Neutral colors aren't boring â€” they're flexible.  
Shades of milk, linen, sand, or warm stone create a calm background that works with any style â€” from minimalist to colorful.

Think of it like a painter's canvas: simple on its own, but once you add a few accents, it comes alive with depth and texture.

> ðŸª¶ Tip: in a large room, paint one wall one or two shades darker â€” it adds dimension.  
In a small living room, stick to one light tone to make the space feel larger.

![Neutral base with soft accents](/images/living-room-colors/neutral-base.png)

---

## 5. Add a Couple of Accents â€” Then Stop

A good interior shouldn't look like a paint catalog.  
Pick no more than two accent colors and repeat them in small details.  
If one wall is deep emerald, let that tone echo in the cushions or artwork.

Natural combinations always win â€” **olive and terracotta**, **beige and sage green**.  
Terracotta, from the Italian *terra cotta* ("baked earth"), is a warm clay-red tone that feels organic and comforting.  
It pairs beautifully with natural textures like wood, linen, and stone â€” cozy, timeless, and never artificial.

> ðŸŽ¨ The classic 70/20/10 rule works perfectly:  
> 70% base color, 20% complementary, 10% accents.

![Accent wall and decor in the same palette](/images/living-room-colors/accent-wall.png)

---

## 6. Always Do a Paint Test

Before painting the whole room, buy a small can and paint a 1Ã—1 m test square.  
Watch it for a couple of days: how it looks under daylight, warm light, and night lamps.

If in doubt, pick a shade **one or two steps lighter** â€” paint almost always appears darker on the wall than in the sample book.

> ðŸ§ª To check the existing finish, dab a cotton pad with acetone and rub the wall gently.  
If the pad stays clean, the old coating is durable enough to repaint.  
This trick works for acrylic and latex paints but not for decorative or enamel ones.

![Paint test on the wall before renovation](/images/living-room-colors/paint-test.png)

---

> ðŸ  In the end, color isn't just about style â€” it's about mood, comfort, and how your home feels to live in.  
> The perfect living room isn't the one from Pinterest â€” it's the one where you want to stay just a little longer.

---

title: How to Paint Walls: Complete Step-by-Step Guide 2025
description: Learn how to paint walls yourself: choose paint, gather tools, apply coats correctly. Professional tips and tricks for smooth, lasting results without mistakes.
author: Renohacks
keywords: how to avoid streaks when painting

body.raw:
![How to paint walls yourself in apartment interior](/images/pokraska/paint_cover.png)

# Professional Wall Painting: Complete DIY Guide

> Even the most expensive paint won't help if the walls aren't properly prepared.  
> But the right technique will give you a perfectly smooth and durable result â€” even without calling professionals.

---

## 1. Choosing Paint and Tools

![Choosing paint for walls and painting tools: roller, brushes, masking tape](/images/pokraska/paint_step1.png)

For living spaces, **water-based paints** are most commonly used:
- **Acrylic** â€” versatile and dries quickly,
- **Latex** â€” washable and durable,
- **Silicone** â€” elastic, hides microcracks.

Tools:
- wide and narrow rollers,
- brushes for corners and reveals,
- masking tape,
- plastic paint tray with ribbed section.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** roller with 8â€“12 mm nap length â€” for smooth walls, 12â€“18 mm â€” for textured walls.  
âŒ **Mistake:** cheap roller leaves nap fibers, and without a narrow roller â€” corners will remain unpainted.

---

## 2. Mixing the Paint

![How to properly mix paint before painting walls](/images/pokraska/paint_step2.png)

Before starting, thoroughly mix the paint â€” pigments settle to the bottom.  
For 5L+ containers, better use a **drill mixer attachment**.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro advice:** periodically stir the paint while working.  
âŒ **Mistake:** adding water "by eye" â€” this disrupts paint properties.

---

## 3. Painting Corners and Tight Spots

![Technique for painting wall corners with brush before main painting](/images/pokraska/paint_step3.png)

Start with a brush â€” roller won't reach corners and along baseboards.

**How to do it right:**
- use **flat or angled brush** 30â€“50 mm,
- dip the tip of the brush in paint, remove excess,
- work along masking tape smoothly, without pressure,
- work in 50â€“70 cm sections so the roller can overlap while wet.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** corners are better painted twice, in thin layers.  
âŒ **Mistake:** painting corners with roller or removing tape after full dry.

---

## 4. Main Painting with Roller

![Correct technique for painting walls with roller: W and N pattern method](/images/pokraska/paint_step4.png)

Dip the roller in paint, roll on the ribbed part of the tray, and apply in a **"W" or "N" pattern**, then evenly roll from top to bottom.

**Tips:**
- work in 1â€“1.5 mÂ² sections,
- edges should stay wet,
- first strokes â€” no pressure, last ones â€” light, "rolling".

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** use extension handle for ceilings â€” less strain on arms.  
âŒ **Mistake:** painting chaotically â†’ patches and streaks.

---

## 5. Second Coat

![Painting walls with second coat: why second coat is needed and when to apply it](/images/pokraska/paint_step5.png)

First coat â€” base, second makes color richer.  
Wait **2â€“4 hours**, or check the label for exact drying time.

ðŸ’¡ **Advice:** apply second coat **perpendicular to the first** â€” this eliminates roller marks.  
âŒ **Mistake:** starting second coat too early â€” paint will "peel".

---

## 6. Finishing and Cleanup

![Finishing wall painting: removing masking tape and cleaning tools](/images/pokraska/paint_step6.png)

Final steps:
- remove tape while paint is slightly wet,
- wash tools with warm water,
- ventilate room without drafts.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** wrap roller in plastic wrap â€” won't dry out for a day.  
âŒ **Mistake:** forgetting to remove tape â†’ paint edge may tear or stretch.

---

## Paint Calculator

Before painting, calculate how many liters you'll need:

<PaintCalculator />

Example: 5Ã—3 m room, 2.7 m height, no large windows â‰ˆ **24 liters** of paint.

---

## Summary

Painting walls is not complicated, but requires care.  
Follow the steps, don't rush, and the result will look professional.  
Smooth color, clean lines, and neat corners â€” all possible to do yourself.

---

## â“ Frequently Asked Questions About Painting Walls

### ðŸ“Œ How Long Does Paint Take to Dry on Walls?

**Usually 2â€“4 hours** for the first coat and the same for the second. For complete drying, it takes **24 hours**. Time depends on paint type and room temperature.

### ðŸ“Œ How to Calculate Paint Amount?

Use our **[paint calculator](#paint-calculator)** above. Multiply room perimeter by wall height and subtract window and door areas.

### ðŸ“Œ Can I Paint Walls Without Primer?

You can, but primer:
- Improves paint adhesion
- Saves 20â€“30% of paint
- Increases coating durability

**Bottom line:** primer is essential for quality results.

### ðŸ“Œ Which Paint is Best for Apartment Walls?

**Top 3 by quality:**
1. **Acrylic water-based** â€” versatile, dries quickly
2. **Latex** â€” washable, water-resistant
3. **Silicone** â€” hides cracks, "breathes"

### ðŸ“Œ Why Are There Streaks After Painting?

**Causes:**
- âŒ Old or cheap roller
- âŒ Too dry roller
- âŒ Insufficient paint mixing
- âŒ Chaotic application without rolling

**Solution:** use W or N pattern, roll same area twice.

### ðŸ“Œ How Much Does Professional Wall Painting Cost?

Average cost **$2â€“6/ftÂ²** ($22â€“64/mÂ²) in major US cities (2025, prices are approximate). For a 150 ftÂ² (14 mÂ²) room, that's **$300â€“900**. Doing it yourself saves **$20â€“45/mÂ²** ($1.85â€“4.20/ftÂ²) â€” materials cost about $200â€“300 for a typical room (paint $30â€“50/gallon covers 300â€“400 ftÂ²).

---

title: Preparing Walls for Painting
description: Step-by-step wall prep: covering furniture, taping edges, filling cracks, sanding, and priming for a flawless paint job.
author: Renohacks
keywords: how to prepare walls for paint

body.raw:
![Wall preparation before painting](/images/podgotovka/paint_4.png)

# The Foundation of Perfect Walls: Complete Preparation Guide

> Flawless, long-lasting paint starts before you even open the can â€” with proper **wall preparation**: covering, spackling, sanding, and priming.

Even the most expensive paint won't give you a smooth, durable finish if your walls aren't prepared.  
These simple steps will help you avoid mistakes and unnecessary costs.

---

## 1. Covering Floors and Furniture

![Covering floors and furniture](/images/podgotovka/step1.png)

Before starting work, cover the floor with a protective plastic sheet or heavy cloth. This will protect against stains.  
If you can't move furniture out â€” cover it with plastic and secure the covering with painter's tape.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** use construction tape with an attached plastic sheet already attached â€” it saves time and nerves.

---

## 2. Taping Corners and Baseboards

![Taping corners and baseboards](/images/podgotovka/step2.png)

Painter's tape is essential for crisp paint lines. Use it to mask baseboards, trim, outlets, and light switches.

- The tape should be pressed down firmly, otherwise paint will bleed through.
- Remove the tape right after painting, while the paint is still slightly wet.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** choose quality tape â€” cheap options leave residue and tear easily.

---

## 3. Filling Cracks and Gaps with Spackle

![Filling cracks with spackle](/images/podgotovka/step3.png)

All defects need to be filled with spackle: cracks, chips, and bumps.

1. Clean the crack of dust.
2. Fill it with spackle using a putty knife.
3. Remove excess and smooth the surface.
4. After it dries, lightly sand it.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** for deep cracks, apply several thin coats, otherwise the spackle will crack.

---

## 4. Sanding the Surface

![Sanding the wall](/images/podgotovka/step4.png)

Sanding removes bumps and remnants of old paint.

- Use fine-grit sandpaper (P120â€“P180) or sanding mesh.
- Work evenly, without heavy pressure.
- After sanding, remove dust with a damp sponge or vacuum.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** attach sandpaper to a sanding block or use an orbital sander â€” the result is faster and smoother.

---

## 5. Priming the Walls

![Applying primer](/images/podgotovka/step5.png)

Primer strengthens the base and improves paint adhesion.

1. Stir the primer.
2. Apply with a roller on large areas, use a brush in corners.
3. Let the coat dry (usually 4â€“6 hours).

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** don't skimp on primer â€” it will reduce paint consumption and extend the life of the finish.

---

## ðŸ“ Paint Calculator

Before moving on to painting, calculate how many gallons of paint you'll need for your room:

<PaintCalculator />

Example: room 16Ã—10 ft, ceiling 9 ft, without large windows â‰ˆ **6â€“7 gallons** of paint.

---

## âœ… Summary

Preparation takes longer than the painting itself, but it determines the quality of the result.  
Follow each step â€” and the paint will go on smooth, without drips or bubbles, and your walls will look great for many years.

---
