title: 5 Renovation Tips to Stay Sane
description: Planning, budget, material selection, and quality control â€” proven steps to renovate without chaos and extra costs.
author: Renohacks
keywords: how to stay sane during renovation

body.raw:
![Renovation without chaos â€” Renohacks tips](/images/remont-sovety-5/remont-lifehacks.png)

> **TL;DR:** planning, +20% to budget, quality materials, room-by-room approach, and on-site quality checks â€” these five pillars will keep your renovation sane and stress-free.

Renovation rarely goes perfectly smoothly. But with a solid plan and common sense, you can preserve your nerves, money, and even relationships.

---

## 1. Start with a Plan (Otherwise Chaos is Guaranteed)

Renovation without a plan turns into a series of surprises: outlets end up in the wrong places, or furniture doesn't fit through doorways.  
Even a simple checklist with stages and materials will save you from chaos and shave weeks off your timeline.

![Renovation plan: checklist of stages, materials, electrical points](/images/remont-sovety-5/remont-plan.png)

---

## 2. Budget Always Exceeds Initial Estimates

However accurate your initial estimate, reality usually adds another 20% to it.  
The reasons vary: delivery fees, moving materials upstairs, additional tools, small issues you forgot about.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** build a buffer into your budget from the start. It's better to have money left over than to have to cut corners mid-project.

![Renovation budget with 20% reserve: money and expense table](/images/remont-sovety-5/remont-budget.png)

---

## 3. Materials Are the Foundation of the Result

Cheap paint or tile may look fine in the store, but in reality you often get streaks, chips, or color fading.  
Quality materials cost more initially, but they determine how long your finish will last and how your space will look.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** choose materials not just by price, but also by reviews from contractors and customers. Look at real photos after use.

![Choosing quality materials: paint, tile, and finish samples](/images/remont-sovety-5/remont-materials.png)

---

## 4. Renovate Room by Room

Trying to redo the entire apartment at once turns your home into a construction site: noise, dust, and no normal living conditions.  
It's much wiser to renovate one room at a time â€” that way you can live in one part while the other is being renovated.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** start with the most critical zones (e.g., bathroom or kitchen), then move to the rest.

![Room-by-room renovation: one done, another in progress](/images/remont-sovety-5/remont-rooms.png)

---

## 5. Check Quality as You Go

Errors made during construction are expensive and complicated to fix later.  
Regular on-site quality checks will prevent such surprises.

ðŸ’¡ **Pro tip:** check important details as work progresses, not just by eye after the work is done.

![Quality check: using level to verify tile installation in bathroom](/images/remont-sovety-5/remont-check.png)

---

## Pre-Launch Checklist

- Work plan by stages and rooms
- Budget + **20% reserve**
- Material list + alternatives
- Delivery and contractor schedule
- Quality checkpoints: electrical, plumbing, geometry, seams, surface prep

---

## ðŸ’¬ FAQ: Quick Answers

**How to calculate the reserve?**  
Take your estimate and multiply by 1.2 â€” that's your working ceiling.

**Which room to start with?**  
Usually the critical zones: **bathroom â†’ kitchen â†’ bedrooms/living room**.

**Where shouldn't you cut costs?**  
Wall prep, waterproofing, and quality paint â€” mistakes here come back quickly.

---

## ðŸ Bottom Line

Renovation almost always involves dust and stress, but with the right approach it stops being a nightmare.  
A clear plan, reasonable budget, reliable materials, and quality control turn the process into something predictable and successful.

ðŸ‘‰ Share your experience in the comments and check out the tag [#renovation](/en/tags/renovation).

![Happy family enjoying their newly renovated apartment](/images/remont-sovety-5/remont-happy.png)

---

title: Apartment Renovation from Rough Finish: Complete Guide
description: Step-by-step guide to renovating an apartment with a rough finish â€” from planning and utilities to cozy interiors and final touches.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# From Bare Walls to Beautiful Home: The Complete Renovation Journey

Renovation is a philosophical thing. Some start it with enthusiasm, others with a sense of doom. But no matter how different your plans and tastes are, the stages are roughly the same. The main goal is to go through them without losing your sanity â€” and ideally, with a bit of pride.

---

## 1. Preparation - think before you drill

Preparation is the foundation of any renovation. Without it, the rest turns into an IKEA challenge without the manual.  
Make a **personal plan**: where sockets will be, where the sofa will live, and where your sacred coffee machine will stand.  
If you're planning **layout changes**, deal with them now, before your neighbors wonder why new cracks appeared on their wall.  
And compare **prices and delivery terms** for materials â€” sometimes "saved money" and "spent a fortune" are just different stores.

---

## 2. Utilities - the invisible magic behind the walls

This is the stage where your place starts to look like a scene from a movie about electricians and plumbers.  
**Electricity:** mark where the lights and switches will go â€” and where *not* to hang a shelf later.  
**Plumbing:** pipes, drains, water outlets â€” boring now, but deeply appreciated later when nothing leaks.  
Don't skimp on professionals here. A one-centimeter mistake today can lead to liters of regret tomorrow.

---

## 3. Rough work - dusty, messy, essential

Leveling ceilings, walls, and floors isn't glamorous, but it's the difference between calm nights and daily annoyance.  
Skip this, and your wallpaper will develop artistic folds, while the wardrobe leans philosophically sideways.  
Yes, it's dusty. Yes, it's noisy. But your future comfort is being born in this chaos. Hang in there â€” beauty is coming.

---

## 4. Tiling - little squares of happiness

Bathroom, floors, kitchen backsplash â€” this is where civilization begins.  
Here, precision matters: every millimeter counts.  
Don't be afraid of bold textures â€” wood-look or stone-look tiles have earned their place.  
And if you're laying tiles yourself, bring patience and a good level â€” both literally and spiritually.

---

## 5. Finishing prep - getting that perfect base

Puttying, priming, light sanding â€” it's basically a spa day for your walls.  
Don't rush this stage. Smooth surfaces mean smooth results.  
Even expensive paint can't hide sloppy prep.  
When everything's flawless, walls reflect the light â€” and your mood with it.

---

## 6. Flooring - walk proudly

Laminate, parquet, vinyl, linoleum â€” the choice depends on budget, style, and cleaning habits.  
Don't forget the underlay: without it, your floor might sing ballads with every step.  
And yes, heated floors in the kitchen and bathroom aren't a luxury â€” they're pure morning joy.

---

## 7. Bathroom - the temple of silence and reflection

Bathtub, shower, faucets, toilet â€” this is where genius renovation ideas are born.  
Check all connections and seals carefully.  
If nothing leaks and the water goes where it should, congratulations â€” you've reached plumbing nirvana.

---

## 8. Walls and ceiling - color your world

Paint or wallpaper? Just not both, please.  
Painting takes patience but rewards you with clean minimalism.  
Wallpaper adds warmth, especially with subtle textures.  
A touch of color turns the place from "just an apartment" into *your* home.

---

## 9. The finale: doors, baseboards, outlets, lighting

This is the glorious moment. The door closes softly, the switch clicks satisfyingly,  
and the chandelier lights up your triumph.  
Baseboards hide the last secrets of renovation, sockets await their gadgets â€” it's the punctuation mark in your renovation novel.

---

## 10. Filling it with comfort - the best part

Furniture, curtains, cushions, plants â€” everything that transforms "just renovated" into "home sweet home."  
This is when you start smiling, even while looking at the bill for the sofa.  
Add some coffee aroma, a few framed photos â€” and yes, you've officially won the renovation war.

---

## Conclusion

This is a universal roadmap for renovating an apartment with a rough finish.  
Some stages may switch places, stretch in time, or disappear altogether â€” and that's okay.  
With a bit of logic, patience, and humor, you'll make it through.  
Remember: a perfect home isn't spotless â€” it's simply a place where you feel **good**.

---

title: Small Studio Apartment: Smart Design Ideas for Maximum Comfort
description: Turn a small studio into a functional and cozy home: smart zoning, multifunctional furniture, vertical storage, layered lighting, and a hidden kitchen â€” without major renovations.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Small Studio Apartment: Big Comfort in a Compact Space

> A small studio apartment is not a limitation â€” itâ€™s a design challenge.  
> Learn how to turn a compact space into a **comfortable, functional home** with smart zoning, storage, lighting, and furniture â€” no major renovation required.

A studio apartment forces you to rethink traditional interior rules.  
When every square meter counts, only **strategic design solutions** can transform a plain â€œconcrete boxâ€ into a cozy and flexible living space.

![Modern small studio apartment interior](/images/studio-makeover/top-view.png "Cozy and functional small studio apartment")

---

## Where to Start: Smart Space Planning

A successful studio makeover starts with **planning**, not decoration.

Focus on:
- zoning without walls,
- furniture that serves multiple purposes,
- vertical storage,
- lighting scenarios instead of one ceiling lamp.

ðŸ§  *Good planning makes a small space feel twice as big.*

---

## Zoning Without Visual Clutter

![Studio zoning with open shelving](/images/studio-makeover/zoning.png "Zoning without solid partitions")

**The biggest mistake** in studios is building solid walls.  
They block light and visually shrink the space.

**Better solutions:**
- **Open shelving units** â€” separate sleeping and living zones while keeping light flow.
- **Floor textures** â€” rug in the living area, tiles in the kitchen create psychological boundaries.
- **Curtains or glass panels** â€” optional, lightweight zoning without heaviness.

---

## Furniture That Works Overtime

![Multifunctional furniture in a studio](/images/studio-makeover/furniture.png "Furniture that saves space")

In a studio, every piece of furniture should earn its place.

**Best choices:**
- **Wall beds / Murphy beds** â€” hidden during the day.
- **Console-to-dining tables** â€” compact yet practical.
- **Beds and sofas with storage** â€” replace bulky cabinets.

ðŸ’¡ *If furniture has only one function, itâ€™s wasting space.*

---

## Vertical Storage: Use the Walls

![Ceiling-height cabinets in a studio](/images/studio-makeover/storage.png "Vertical storage solutions")

Floor area is limited â€” walls are not.

**Smart vertical ideas:**
- **Ceiling-height wardrobes** â€” visually raise the ceiling and store everything.
- **Mezzanine shelves** â€” perfect for suitcases, seasonal dÃ©cor, boxes.
- **Wall-mounted shelves** â€” free the floor and add rhythm to the interior.

---

## Lighting: Create Scenarios, Not Shadows

![Layered lighting in a studio apartment](/images/studio-makeover/lighting.png "Layered lighting creates atmosphere")

One ceiling light is never enough in a studio.

**Use layered lighting:**
- **Under-cabinet LEDs** â€” task lighting.
- **Floor lamps** â€” reading and relaxation.
- **Soft bedside lighting** â€” calm evening atmosphere.

ðŸŒ™ *Turning off kitchen lights at night visually transforms the studio into a bedroom.*

---

## The Hidden Kitchen Effect

![Hidden kitchen in a studio apartment](/images/studio-makeover/kitchen.png "Kitchen blended into living space")

In a studio, the kitchen is part of the living room â€” it shouldnâ€™t dominate.

**How to make it disappear:**
- **Handleless cabinets** (push-to-open).
- **Built-in appliances** behind matching fronts.
- **Wall-colored facades** to blend with the interior.

Result: less visual noise, more harmony.

---

## Small Studio Makeover Checklist

- [ ] Plan zoning without walls
- [ ] Choose multifunctional furniture
- [ ] Add storage up to the ceiling
- [ ] Install layered lighting
- [ ] Hide the kitchen visually
- [ ] Reduce visual clutter
- [ ] Add textiles and dÃ©cor last

---

## â“ FAQ

**â± Is this suitable for rentals?**  
Yes â€” most solutions are removable and non-invasive.

**ðŸ›  Do I need major renovation?**  
No â€” all ideas work without demolition.

**ðŸ“ What matters more: storage or furniture?**  
Storage first. Furniture comes second.

**ðŸ’¡ Biggest visual trick?**  
Lighting + vertical lines.

---

## ðŸ Conclusion

The secret of a perfect studio apartment lies in **balance**:  
minimum visual clutter and maximum functionality.

Start with storage planning, add smart lighting, and choose furniture wisely â€”  
and even the smallest studio can feel spacious and comfortable.

---

ðŸ“¸ *Photos: Renohacks.com collection*

title: Types of Modular Homes
description: Learn about the main types of modular homes â€” frame, block, container, and composite â€” plus their materials, styles, and key benefits.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
# Modular Living: Exploring Different Types of Prefab Homes

What modular homes are and why they've become so popular.  
Let's explore their main construction types, materials, sizes, and design styles.

![Modern modular home exterior](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/modern-modular-home.jpg)

---

## What Is a Modular Home

A **modular home** is a prefabricated building assembled from factory-made blocks (modules).  
Each module is produced with interior finishing, utilities, and layout in place â€”  
reducing construction time and ensuring consistent quality in any season.

![Assembly of modular home sections](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/assembly.jpg)

---

## Main Construction Types

### Frame Modular Homes
Built on a wooden or metal frame, insulated and clad with modern materials.  
Lightweight, warm, and durable with proper care.

![Wood frame modular home structure](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/frame-house.jpg)

**Advantages:**
- fast assembly;
- energy efficiency;
- easy maintenance;
- reliable structure.

---

### Block-Modular Homes
Each block is fully manufactured at the factory and delivered ready for installation â€”  
complete with windows, doors, and interior finishing.

![Factory-assembled block modular house](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/block-house.jpg)

**Benefits:**
- quick assembly;
- high precision;
- minimal on-site work;
- easy expansion.

---

### Container Homes
Made from repurposed shipping containers.  
Strong, mobile, and industrial in style â€” often used for offices, cafÃ©s, or seasonal housing.

![Container modular home](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/container-home.jpg)

---

## Materials Used

### Wood
Eco-friendly, warm, and aesthetically natural. Needs protective treatment against moisture and fire.  
![Wood modular home exterior](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/wood-house.jpg)

### Metal
Durable and fire-resistant â€” suitable for commercial and northern climates.  
Requires anti-corrosion coating.  
![Metal modular home](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/metal-house.jpg)

### Composites (Sandwich Panels)
Lightweight, sealed, and energy-efficient.  
Easy to transport, assemble, and maintain.  
![Composite sandwich panels](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/composite-panels.jpg)

---

## Sizes and Purpose

- **Compact (up to 25 mÂ²)** â€” for leisure or rentals.

- **Medium (30â€“70 mÂ²)** â€” ideal for couples or small families.

- **Large (80 mÂ² +)** â€” multi-module homes for full-time living.

Modular structures are also used for **offices, cafÃ©s, glamping sites, and storage facilities** â€” where speed and flexibility matter most.

---

## Design Styles

**Modern:** minimalist forms, glass, metal, and clean geometry.  
![Modern modular design](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/style-modern.jpg)

**Scandinavian:** light wood tones, panoramic windows, cozy interiors.  
![Scandinavian modular home](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/style-scandinavian.jpg)

**Classic:** symmetry, stone or brick-like facades.  
![Classic modular home](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/style-classic.jpg)

**Loft:** open space, concrete, exposed pipes.  
![Loft-style modular house](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/style-loft.jpg)

**Eco:** natural and recycled materials, green roofs.  
![Eco modular home](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/style-eco.jpg)

**Custom:** flexible layouts with terraces, garages, or attics.  
![Custom modular home project](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/style-custom.jpg)

---

## How to Choose a Modular Home

1. Define your purpose â€” permanent or temporary.
2. Review the layout and included features.
3. Check the builder's portfolio and client feedback.
4. Consider transport and foundation requirements.

![Choosing the right modular home](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/choose.jpg)

---

## Summary

Modular homes combine speed, precision, and comfort.  
They're a smart alternative to traditional construction â€”  
ready-made, energy-efficient, and adaptable to your lifestyle.

![Future of modular housing](/images/vidy-modulnykh-domov/future.jpg)

---

headings.text: How to Choose a Modular Home

title: Main Types of Wallpaper: Features, Pros, and Best Use
description: Explore six main types of wallpaper â€” from classic paper to modern fiberglass. Real insights on durability, texture, and where each works best.
author: Renohacks

body.raw:
![Modern living room with wallpaper](/images/wallpapers/cover.png)

# Wallpaper Guide: 6 Types for Every Home and Lifestyle

> Wallpaper is like clothing for your walls â€” it gives them texture, warmth, and character.  
Choosing the right one isn't about following trends, it's about understanding what will survive real life â€” kids, moisture, sunlight, and the occasional coffee splash.

Wallpaper has come a long way. What used to peel after one season can now last decades, resist humidity, and even be washed with a sponge.  
Let's break down the **six most common types of wallpaper**, their quirks, and where they truly shine.

---

## 1. Paper Wallpaper

![Paper wallpaper](/images/wallpapers/paper.png)

Still the simplest and most natural option.  
Made from pure cellulose, available as **simplex** (one layer) or **duplex** (two layers) â€” breathable and eco-friendly.

**Pros:** light, affordable, and easy to apply.  
**Cons:** fades in sunlight, not washable, short lifespan.

> ðŸ’¡ *Tip:* Perfect if you're decorating a rental or want to change the look every few years.

*Best for:* bedrooms and living rooms where the walls aren't touched too often.

---

## 2. Vinyl Wallpaper

![Vinyl wallpaper](/images/wallpapers/vinyl.png)

Vinyl has a paper or non-woven base with a PVC top layer.  
It's tough, washable, and comes in endless designs â€” from brick texture to silk gloss.

**Pros:** durable, easy to clean, hides small wall defects.  
**Cons:** traps moisture, not ideal for poorly ventilated rooms.

> ðŸ§½ If you have kids or pets, go for *matte washable vinyl* â€” no glare, and fingerprints wipe off with a damp cloth.

*Best for:* kitchens, hallways, and family spaces with daily wear and tear.

---

## 3. Non-woven Wallpaper

![Non-woven wallpaper](/images/wallpapers/nonwoven.png)

A blend of natural and synthetic fibers pressed into a sturdy base.  
You don't paste the wallpaper â€” you paste the wall.  
It doesn't stretch, tear, or bubble.

**Pros:** strong, flexible, breathable, hides uneven walls.  
**Cons:** collects a bit of dust, slightly more expensive.

> ðŸŽ¨ Can be painted several times â€” ideal for people who like to "refresh the mood" without removing old wallpaper.

*Best for:* new buildings or rooms with slight wall movement (cracks won't show).

---

## 4. Fiberglass Wallpaper

![Fiberglass wallpaper](/images/wallpapers/fiberglass.png)

Woven from fine glass threads, these wallpapers look tough â€” and they are.  
They're always paintable and can survive almost anything.

**Pros:** fireproof, moisture-resistant, can be repainted up to ten times, lifespan 20â€“30 years.  
**Cons:** rough surface, needs special adhesive, pricier.

> ðŸ”¥ Great for commercial spaces or for homes with "active walls" â€” where chairs scrape and life happens. Cats can't destroy them either.

*Best for:* corridors, offices, or long-term home renovations where durability matters.

---

## 5. Liquid Wallpaper

![Liquid wallpaper](/images/wallpapers/liquid.png)

This one's applied like plaster.  
A mix of cellulose, cotton fibers, and glue that you spread with a trowel.  
It dries into a seamless textured surface â€” no joints, no waste.

**Pros:** hides cracks and uneven walls, no seams, easy to repair.  
**Cons:** not waterproof unless sealed with varnish, slow drying.

> ðŸª¶ If your walls are crooked, this is your friend â€” it fills and masks everything without sanding dust.

*Best for:* bedrooms, living rooms, or creative accent walls.

---

## 6. Textile Wallpaper

![Textile wallpaper](/images/wallpapers/textile.png)

The most tactile and elegant of all.  
Linen, silk, or jute threads on a paper or non-woven base.  
They absorb sound and make any room instantly cozy.

**Pros:** warm texture, luxurious look, eco-friendly, good insulation.  
**Cons:** catches dust, absorbs odors, needs delicate cleaning.

> âœ¨ Works wonders in spaces where you want softness â€” a quiet office, a calm bedroom, or a hotel-style living room.

*Best for:* premium interiors and accent walls where beauty outweighs maintenance.

---

## âœ… Final Thoughts

Choosing wallpaper isn't just about color â€” it's about **how your walls feel to live with**.  
A family with toddlers and a dog needs something washable.  
A city apartment with uneven walls benefits from a forgiving texture.  
And a calm retreat might call for fabric that softens every sound.

> Pick the material that matches your lifestyle, not just your Pinterest board â€” and your walls will thank you for years.

---
